intro: Cyrtandra quinquenotata, commonly known as the five-streaked cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful leaves with five longitudinal streaks. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its flowers are usually small and tubular, with five lobes, and are typically borne in clusters. Cyrtandra quinquenotata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
